etymology.description: 𡍬 (phonetic) + 貝 (semantic: 'cowry', a symbol of money) -> original form 𧸇 -> 𡍬 reduced to 士 and 四 -> final form 𧶠
etymology.interpretation: The character 𧶠 represents the concept of selling, with 貝(貝) (bèi, 'cowry') symbolizing money or trade, while 𡍬 acts as the phonetic component lending the sound lù. Over time, 𡍬 was simplified into 士(士) (shì, 'scholar') and 四(四) (sì, 'four'), evolving into the present form of the character.
